discussion.p: The resolution for LWG enabled code like the following to be accepted:
but breaks code that had been previously working like the following

blockquote.pre:
using value_type = pair<const int, int>;
map m2{{value_type{1, 2}, {3, 4}}, less<int>()};

discussion.p:
as shown on godbolt.
[Acknowledgment to Tim Song and Arthur O'Dwyer for independently pointing out this case on the LWG mailing list]

resolution.p: This wording is relative to N4878.

blockquote.p: We present two partial wording options for std::map, denoted by (A) and (B) below. If the committee accepts one of them, we will complete them to all key-value containers.

li.p: (A) Wording option 1: In this option, we restore the deduction guide that was removed in LWG while maintaining the one that was added, demonstrates this working.

(B) Wording option 2: This one follows Tim Song's suggestion: "It seems that the cleanest fix is to 1) disallow the initializer_list<value_type> constructors from being used for CTAD, and 2) change the guides to use remove_const_t<Key>." This change has been tested locally with g++ similar to the above godbolt.
